author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Confederate monument protection bill filed in Senate
text:
Summary by Ground News Sen. Jonathan Martin's SB 1122 would impose penalties on local officials who removed historical monuments after July 1, 2024. Martin's bill is a companion to a similar House bill from Rep. Dean Black. Black's bill seems to have been the impetus for the decision of the Jacksonville Mayor to authorize the removal of the Jim Crow era monument this week. Share menu More
Filters 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right
Florida Politics Center High Factuality Confederate monument protection bill filed in Senate The House version was filed earlier this year, before Jacksonville removed its last Jim Crow era statue.

author: loboatomico2
title: #14 Pasadle estos datos y gr√°ficos a los partidarios de Javier Milei a ver si alguno tiene la poca verg√ºenza de decir que lo est√° haciendo bien en Argentina
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
Todos esos gr√°ficos ya los adelant√≥ en su campa√±a, no son nada que no se supiera. Argentina ten√≠a un modo de gesti√≥n con un d√©ficit tan loco que para encauzarlo habr√≠a que hacer sacrificios. Se dijo de sobra, 2 d√©cadas con la mayor p√©rdida de poder adquisitivo de todo occidente, se trataba de elegir seguir as√≠ o romper esa inercia pero con unos a√±os malos.
De verdad, es rid√≠culo. Argentina es el peor caso de gesti√≥n econ√≥mica de este siglo, habr√≠a que ir a Venezuela o pa√≠ses del 3er mundo o a pa√≠ses en guerra para ver algo comparable. Es mucho canteo que el meneante medio no tenga ni pu√±eter√≠sima idea de lo que ha estado pasando en Argentina los √∫ltimos 20-30 a√±os, y de pronto para criticar a un rival ideol√≥gico medio foro se autoproclame catedr√°tico en argentinolog√≠a.
[#5](c5#c-5) tb resulta un poco curioso que todos los defensores de Milei en meneame son expertos en argentinologia . O no?
[#6](c6#c-6) A m√≠ siempre me ha parecido un mamarracho. Pero es una consecuencia l√≥gica de la Argentina desde los 90 hasta hoy.
Ponerse a hacer gr√°ficos con un excel y echarse las manos a la cabeza es absurdo tras ni medio a√±o de Milei, que adem√°s no es nada que no se supiera. Argentina es un pa√≠s cuya econom√≠a daba para por lo menos una portada mensual en men√©ame desde antes de la creaci√≥n del propio portal.
Hacedle caso a Eduardo Garz√≥n, que tiene la receta para solucionar lo de Argentina:
‚¶Å Eduardo Garz√≥n: "Argentina no est√° limitada en t√©rminos financieros. Todos los pesos que se quieran crear, se pueden crear"
‚¶Å Eduardo Garz√≥n: "La soluci√≥n al paro es teclear dinero"
‚¶Å Eduardo Garz√≥n: "El dinero es un invento y se puede crear sin l√≠mites"
‚¶Å Eduardo Garz√≥n: "El dinero lo crea y regula el sector p√∫blico, por lo que √©ste no necesita recaudar impuestos para financiarse."
‚¶Å Eduardo Garz√≥n: "Los ingresos de los funcionarios provienen del gasto del Estado, no de ning√∫n impuesto."
‚¶Å Eduardo Garz√≥n: Como si llega al 250% del PIB,como en Jap√≥n y viven mejor que nosotros, mientras el BCE siga comprando bonos la deuda p√∫blica no debe preocupar
Me jode tener yo que defender al mongolo de Milei, pero vamos si quitas subsidios y desregulas sectores es seguro que pasar√≠a lo que est√° pasando.
Otro punto es el precio a pagar por ello y si estas medidas van a mejorar el pa√≠s en el medio-largo plazo o lo van a mandar al abismo directamente reventando la cohesi√≥n social.
[#4](c4#c-4) "El interrogante que m√°s insiste con respecto a la ultraderecha argentina se refiere a la adhesi√≥n que aun suscita en sectores amplios de la poblaci√≥n.
En efecto, un gobierno que no gobierna, un grupo de funcionarios inconsistentes y crueles, una agrupaci√≥n de pol√≠ticos bizarros que parecen testimoniar de una mutaci√≥n antropol√≥gica en el centro del neoliberalismo provocan en el mundo la pregunta crucial: porqu√© un experimento con un coste de dolor tan amplio para la sociedad argentina no solo es soportable sino que parece estar apoyado por una fe inquebrantable.
Responder a esto exigir√≠a un conjunto de lecturas que sepan al menos caracterizar en qu√© tiempo hist√≥rico vivimos y si somos contempor√°neos de algo nuevo y distinto. Pero mas all√° de la necesaria reflexi√≥n te√≥rica y cr√≠tica con respecto a la tragedia que le toca vivir a la Argentina, la √∫nica posibilidad de responder a esta situaci√≥n siniestra es no dejarse subyugar por la foto fija de las encuestas y los votos obtenidos.
Las encuestas y el sistema de votaci√≥n nunca logran captar ciertos momentos privilegiados de lo micropol√≠tico y de su capilarizaci√≥n en el tejido social. El supuesto 50 por ciento de apoyo del que dispone el ultraderechista se puede volatilizar de un instante a otro, y entonces puede emerger la verdad del militante, la verdad del que no cede, y entrega su vida a la m√°s inmediata de las urgencias: combatir el hambre. Ya sabemos de qui√©n estamos hablando.
Esta es la hora de quien no se deja obnubilar por el peso inerte de los n√∫meros y abraza la verdadera causa, la verdadera raz√≥n por la que ha decidido entregar su vida a la justicia.
Frente al nihilismo de las encuestas, la verdad incondicional de la justicia social; no importa lo que digan si alguien ha decidido no prestarles mas atenci√≥n.
En cada hombre y en cada mujer, uno por uno, en donde vibre una sensibilidad por la justicia y por el otro, un nuevo lazo social, un nuevo amor va abriendo su camino. Los d√≠as de la nueva pol√≠tica estan por venir".
[#8](c8#c-8) Por la misma razon que todos los que se quejan de nuestros fachas politicos, jueces, periodistas, empresarios...siguen aqui y no se van a otros paises superdemocraticos.

author: Charlotte Hazard
title: Combat Antisemitism movement holds fundraiser for Israelis caught in wildfires created by Hezbollah
text: Combat Antisemitism movement holds fundraiser for Israelis caught in wildfires created by Hezbollah According to the fundraiser details, between 20 and 150 rockets are launched daily at northern Israel, hitting rural areas and agricultural land. The Combat Antisemitism Movement is hosting an [online fundraiser](https://givebutter.com/FireNorth) to support Israelis in northern Israel affected by wildfires caused by attacks from Hezbollah, the Iranian proxy group that dominates Lebanon. "Urgent: Northern Israel is under fire! Hezbollah's relentless rocket attacks are igniting devastating wildfires," the Combat Antisemitism Movement's CEO Sacha Roytman wrote on [the social media platform, X](https://x.com/sacharoytman/status/1803887305478017471?s=43). "We need your help now! Join our emergency fundraiser to equip 33 rural communities with essential firefighting kits. Act fast‚Äîlives and homes are at stake!" the post continued. According to the fundraiser details, between 20 and 150 rockets and drones are launched daily at northern Israel, hitting rural areas and agricultural land. "In just the past two months, these rocket-induced fires have devastated hundreds of acres, leaving homes reduced to ashes and communities in peril," the website says. "Our firefighting efforts are critically undermined by a shortage of resources, with many affected areas being difficult to reach with traditional firefighting equipment." Israel has been at war since Oct. 7, 2023, when the terrorist group, Hamas, conducted a surprise attack from Gaza and killed approximately 1,200 Israelis. The war has been ongoing for months and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is expected to address Congress in July.

author: Roberta De Carolis
title: Tre uomini salvano miracolosamente 38 cani che rischiavano di affogare nel Mississippi
text:
Bob Gist, pescatore di 61 anni, il suo amico Brad Carlisl e Jordan Chrestman, guida di pesca, hanno salvato dal Mississippi 38 cani che rischiavano di affogare nel fiume. I cani stavano inseguendo un cervo, anche lui in acqua. L‚Äôeroico salvataggio √® davvero quasi un miracolo
Bob Gist, Brad Carlisle e Jordan Chrestman erano tre uomini come tanti ma due settimane fa si sono resi protagonisti di un eroico gesto, salvando 38 cani che rischiavano di affogare nel Mississippi. I cani stavano inseguendo il cervo e tutti erano in palese difficolt√†.
Bob e Brad, amici di vecchia data, si erano diretti al lago Grenada nel Mississippi e si sono messi in contatto con Jordan Chrestman, una guida di pesca locale, che li ha condotti in acqua. L‚Äôidea era trascorrere una mattinata a pescare.
Ma, dopo aver pescato nelle prime ore del mattino, senza troppa ‚Äúfortuna‚Äù in realt√†, il gruppo si √® spostato in un luogo diverso. Da l√¨ la giornata √® cambiata completamente.
Ci siamo spostati per circa mezzo miglio da dove eravamo in un altro posto e abbiamo iniziato a pescare ‚Äìe ben presto abbiamo sentito alcuni cani abbaiare ‚Äì racconta Bob Gist a Fox News ‚Äì Molto presto abbiamo visto alcuni cani all‚Äôorizzonte nell‚Äôacqua
Chrestman ha invece notato nell‚Äôacqua un cervo, che il gruppo di cani stava tentando di inseguire.
Abbiamo continuato a pescare per altri 10 o 15 minuti, e Jordan ‚ÄúEhi ragazzi, se non vi dispiace, dobbiamo davvero andare a controllare quei cani perch√© sono l√† fuori in acqua‚Äù. Eravamo semplicemente sbalorditi perch√© c‚Äôerano cani ovunque, e stavano andando tutti in direzioni diverse perch√© non riuscivano pi√π a vedere la riva su alcun lato
Fishing crew rescues 38 dogs treading water in lake | Read more:
‚Äî FOX 8 New Orleans (@FOX8NOLA)
[June 20, 2024]
Senza esitazione, gli uomini hanno portato i cani sulla barca per evitare che annegassero. In particolare Chrestman √® riuscito a raccogliere 27 cani, assicurandosi che nessuno di loro tentasse di tornare in acqua.
Gli animali non erano randagi, ma costosi cani da caccia che i loro padroni cercavano disperatamente. Grazie ad un GPS collegato ai loro collari, gli uomini hanno poi trovato altri tre o quattro cani a pi√π di un miglio dalla riva.
Erano sul punto di annegare, perch√© ormai sono rimasti a galla per un‚Äôora ‚Äì ha spiegato Gist ‚Äì Siamo tornati con l‚Äôultimo gruppo di cani‚Ä¶ [e] abbiamo dovuto trascinarli fuori dalla barca perch√© non volevano scendere. Avevano paura di tornare alla acqua. √à stato terribile
I proprietari hanno offerto a Chrestman una ricompensa, ma il ragazzo si √® rifiutato di accettarla.
Se Brad e io fossimo stati l√¨ da soli su una barca, non avremmo saputo che c‚Äôera qualcosa che non andava, ma quel ragazzo di 20 anni e qualcosa ‚Äì io ho 61 anni, quindi lo chiamo ragazzino ‚Äì lui sapeva che bisognava fare qualcosa
Alla fine sono stati salvati 38 cani.
Non vuoi perdere le nostre notizie?
Telegram
 News, attiva preferite

Fox News

author: Mariam Abdullahi
title: Pastor Ibiyeomie‚Äôs Testimony: From Giving N5,000 to Receiving N25,000 and Foodstuff
text:
Sharing his testimony, the presiding pastor of Salvation Ministries, David Ibiyeomie, revealed that a decision to give God his N5,000 salary in 1997 resulted in a series of miracles.
This revelation was made in a video posted on Instagram by the televangelist on May 28, 2024. Standing behind the pulpit, Ibiyeomie recounted how his wife had requested his N5,000 salary to go to the market.
However, he claimed that he heard a divine instruction to give the money to God instead, which he obediently did.
Shortly after offering the N5,000 to God, Ibiyeomie shared that he received N25,000, along with a bag of rice, beans, and a crate of eggs from an unidentified woman.
Reflecting on the incident, he recalled, ‚ÄúIn 1997, my wife informed me of her intention to visit the market, and my salary was N5,000.‚Äù
‚ÄúShe mentioned the market trip to me, and I replied that I would join her. However, God‚Äôs voice directed me to give Him the N5,000. It seemed irrational!‚Äù
He emphasized the need for faith in carrying out such instructions, highlighting the importance of aligning actions with spiritual guidance.
Describing the turn of events, Ibiyeomie continued, ‚ÄúI offered the N5,000 as a sacrifice. Less than an hour later, a woman received a divine message to deliver N25,000, food items, and kitchen supplies to me without even meeting in person.‚Äù
To add to the miraculous sequence, the woman‚Äôs husband, known for his thriftiness, unexpectedly gifted her N1 million on the same day, leading to a subsequent job offer in Abuja.
The responses to Ibiyeomie‚Äôs account have varied among social media users, showcasing a range of opinions and perspectives.
One user, clifofoboss, remarked, ‚ÄúFormat in which you can take all that someone has.‚Äù
While another user, Zonaempire, mentioned an alternate instance involving Pastor Sam Adeyemi, prompting further discussion and reflection.
Supporting Ibiyeomie‚Äôs testimony, users like temi. dayo_ and dj_joeteee expressed sentiments of faith and admiration for the pastor.
In contrast, some users, including Awojideamos, raised questions and urged for diverse discussions beyond giving as a focal point.
Others, like prettiesttiana and Ciponi4real, sought clarification on discerning the voice of God and shared personal anecdotes related to acts of giving and faith.

author: Peter Stuart and Michael Kennedy
title: Catholic and Anglican Bishops' 2024 Easter messages
text: A few weeks ago, I received a cancer diagnosis. I have localised prostate cancer. With medical progress and a great healthcare system, my prognosis is excellent. I am now slowly making my way through the treatment maze. I wasn't really surprised when the doctor confirmed my illness. Many will know that there are often a few clues along the way that tell you something is wrong. It was a blessing to hear my doctor's confidence about the road ahead. I'll be honest, there have been quite a few ups and downs so far. It can be a bit scary at times. "Was that my last Christmas?" and "Will my family be OK if the results are really bad?" were among my questions. Not every bit of speculation was based on facts people were telling me. The mind can dance around as it tries to integrate confronting news. As I write, I am deeply conscious of the people I have met whose health journey is filled with more anguish than mine. All of us live within the shadow of illness, death, and grief to some extent. It is part of the human condition. Knowing the reality that we will all die; we choose how we might live. As a committed Christian, in the Anglican tradition, I have embraced a Christian way of viewing the world. I believe that Jesus was God among us. He was brutally abused and tortured after his teaching and actions offended too many people. Jesus was executed as an ordinary criminal. Beginning three days after his death and then for many days, he was seen. People ate with him, touched him, and talked with him. Jesus rose from the dead and ascended into heaven. He promised that God would do the same for people. The Easter story is a story of good news and hope. The Christian faith has helped me navigate the news about my health. I can summarise its impact in three words: hope, gratitude, and love. Hope: I know that nothing I am enduring can separate me from the love of God. I know that ultimately everything will turn out well in this life or the next. God has promised to accompany people as they go through their dark and troubling days. When our earthly journey is done, we can look forward to being drawn into the heart of God. We have been promised a place where we can be enveloped by God's care forever. Gratitude: I am moved by people and the good they express. My heart is often filled with appreciation for the way people make things better. I am thinking of scientists, medical staff, people who care for others, and the wider community. Many people are working for the good of others. God invites people to live their whole life through a lens of thankfulness. God wants people to celebrate and acknowledge kindness, generosity, and skill in the service of humanity and creation. Love: It is not unusual that shock and tragedy see people reach out to help and care for others. I have certainly experienced this. The heart of the Christian faith is about love of God, love of our neighbour, and love of ourselves. God shows us his overwhelming love and wants us to express this to the people around us. God wants us to know that we are loved. Knowing that we will all die, we have the chance to choose how we might live. Christians recognise that a good part of the pain that people endure is caused by other people. In the pursuit of wealth, power, or control, people will engage in violence or corruption. There are victims from these crimes and misconduct, people who end up with lifelong scars. The ability for people to choose their behaviour is part of the Easter story of good news and hope. We can decide to stop actions that hurt others. We can cease being selfish. We can think of others before we think of ourselves. Each of us can help make the world a better place. We can choose goodness, kindness, and generosity to offer people hope people living in fear and despair. Over many years of pastoral ministry, I have been privileged to hear and share in people's lives. I have seen people kindle hope and opportunity from limited resources. I have witnessed their compassion and love for their families and friends. I have found, and continue to find, in the teaching and works of Jesus a way of flourishing. I experience it as good news. I have the privilege at Easter to share in celebrating the story that Jesus died and rose again; that he will be with us forever. Happy Easter. This time of year, Christians, and our society more broadly, observe and celebrate 'Holy Week' culminating in the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ. During Holy Week I often find myself reflecting upon life and death, upon suffering and love. I once read somewhere and like to repeat at funerals that "grief cannot and does not exist except where there has been love". Grief is actually a privilege - a painful one at that - because it gives expression to the love that we have shared with the departed person. So, even though grief is one of our greatest sufferings, there is also a certain sweetness to it because it is linked to love. Many of the events we Christians commemorate during Holy Week entailed much grief and suffering on the part of Jesus Christ: his unjust arrest and trial; being deserted by his friends and rejected by the crowds that a few days earlier had hailed him their king; his passion in which he was mocked, beaten, scourged, and crowned with thorns; carrying the heavy cross up Mount Calvary; and his crucifixion and death on the cross on Good Friday - the total gift of himself to us. In all of these events the sufferings of Jesus are certainly very prominent. But Holy Week is not really about suffering, it's about loving. It was Jesus' love for God and love for you and me that brought him to his passion and death, and it was his love that opened the way for our redemption. His suffering was a consequence of his loving. And his loving suffering is redemptive: it picks us up; it elevates us; it redeems us. The love of God calls for a response from each of us, and the only adequate response to love is love; a love that is true and faithful; a love that is patient and kind; a love that generates peace and joy; a love that binds people together. Love and suffering. There is suffering in every person's life. Blessed are they whose suffering is a consequence of their loving, for their loving suffering lifts people up and has redemptive power to restore goodness and heal relationships. Of course, the culmination of Jesus' life was not his death on the cross but his resurrection from the dead on Easter Sunday - the sign he said he would give to prove that he is indeed who he said he is - the very Son of God; the God of love and mercy who saves us from sin and promises eternal life. Here in Jesus' death and resurrection we find the greatest of the Christian paradoxes - that death is actually the beginning of life. Or, as Jesus put it on various occasions: the grain of wheat must die in order to give life to the rich harvest of new and more grains of wheat; and the one who clings to life will lose it but the one who lays down their life will find it. Dying to oneself is actually more simple than many people realise. Saint Paul gave us the answer when he said that "Love is patient; love is kind". Being patient by accepting the limitations of others (while being conscious that others are being patient with our own limitations); and being kind, by getting up and doing things to help others, is the simplest of recipes for dying to oneself and finding the fulness of life. Holy Week is the holiest and most solemn week of the Christian year. Days like Good Friday are solemn days, not sad ones. And days like Easter Sunday are pure joy. As we approach Easter, may we each take some time to reflect prayerfully on the life and death, suffering and love of Jesus Christ. May we see in his life and experience in our own life the beautiful link between suffering and love and between life and death. May you know the love of God for you this Easter, and may you respond to his love with your own love. I wish you, your family, and loved ones a truly Happy Easter. Sign up for our newsletter to stay up to date. We care about the protection of your data. Read our [Privacy Policy](/privacy/).

title: "Bienvenida hija": Neymar anunci√≥ que volver√° a ser padre
text:
‚ÄúBienvenida hija‚Äù: Neymar anunci√≥ que volver√° a ser padre
El delantero brasilero Neymar Jr. anunci√≥ que ser√° padre por cuarta vez a trav√©s de un posteo en sus redes sociales en el que confirma que ser√° una ni√±a.
El actual jugador del Al Hilal de Arabia Saudita tendr√° su segunda hija con su actual pareja, Bruna Biancardi.
A trav√©s de una publicaci√≥n conjunta en Instagram, Neymar y Biancardi revelaron que ‚Äú¬°Estamos viviendo en una fase tan dulce, y no pudimos evitar compartir con ustedes que √âl ha escuchado una vez m√°s nuestras peticiones y confirmado nuestros planes! Bienvenida hija. ¬°Muchos retornos felices del d√≠a! Te estamos esperando para completar nuestra familia a√∫n m√°s. Que Dios nos proteja de todo mal‚Äù.
Neymar, por su parte, tambi√©n coment√≥ ‚Äúpadre de 3 princesas, qu√© momento‚Äù. Esta ser√° la cuarta hija de Neymar, que que ya es padre de Davi Lucca (13 a√±os), Mavie (un a√±o) y Helena (naci√≥ en julio del 2023).

author: Joiner Mart√≠nez
title: Girondins de Burdeos renunci√≥ a estatus profesional y rescindi√≥ contrato de todos sus futbolistas
text:
Graves problemas financieros obligan a salir del f√∫tbol profesional, al Girondins de Burdeos , uno de los clubes de f√∫tbol m√°s hist√≥ricos de Francia.
Seg√∫n ha informado a la Federaci√≥n Francesa (FFF), todos los jugadores han sido liberados de sus contratos y el centro de formaci√≥n ser√° cerrado.
La decisi√≥n comunicada a la FFF se produce dos d√≠as despu√©s de que la Direcci√≥n Nacional de Control de Gesti√≥n (DNCG, el gendarme financiero del f√∫tbol franc√©s), releg√≥ al club a la tercera divisi√≥n por sus problemas econ√≥micos y despu√©s de que las negociaciones con un posible grupo inversor no llgaran a buen puerto.
El club anunci√≥ entonces que no apelar√≠a esa decisi√≥n y que aceptaba la sanci√≥n, y hoy comunic√≥ su abandono de la actividad profesional.
COMMUNIQU√â DU CLUB üîµ‚ö™Ô∏è
Suite √† la confirmation de la d√©cision de la DNCG de rel√©guer le FC Girondins de Bordeaux en National 1, le Club a, ce mardi, d√©pos√© le bilan aupr√®s du Tribunal de Commerce de Bordeaux, afin d‚Äôentamer la restructuration n√©cessaire.
En cons√©quence, le‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/arDAXoIVFe
‚Äî FC Girondins de Bordeaux (@girondins) July 25, 2024 El anuncio de hoy lleg√≥ sin esperar a una vista ante un tribunal de comercio, el pr√≥ximo martes 30 de julio, que debe decidir si el club entra administraci√≥n judicial o en un proceso de liquidaci√≥n.
Uno de los jugadores hist√≥ricos del club, Bixente Lizarazu, campe√≥n del mundo con Francia en 1998 y comentarista con la radio p√∫blica francesa, pidi√≥ la dimisi√≥n del propietario, el empresario luxemburgu√©s de origen espa√±ol G√©rard Lopez, que compr√≥ el club en 2021.
‚ÄúLeo que G√©rard Lopez cuenta con seguir como presidente y propietario. ¬øEn serio?. Antes de nada, este se√±or debe desaparecer de Burdeos‚Äù , se√±al√≥ Lizarazu en un mensaje en Instagram.
El club arrastraba problemas econ√≥micos desde hace a√±os y cuando Lopez lo compr√≥, en julio de 2021, ya estaba en una situaci√≥n cr√≠tica, con el club en administraci√≥n judicial desde e abril de ese a√±o.
Sin embargo, Lopez, que se convirti√≥ en el mayor accionista mayoritario en tres a√±os, no logr√≥ con su gesti√≥n enderezar la situaci√≥n deportiva y, sobre todo, financiera de la entidad .
Fundado en 1920 y con estatus profesional desde 1937, el Girondins es un gran club franc√©s, ya que ha ganado seis Ligas, cuatro Copas de Francia y tres Copas de la Liga.
Fue finalista de la Copa de la UEFA de 1996. Por sus filas han pasado leyendas del f√∫tbol franc√©s como Zin√©dine Zidane o Jean Tigana.
Seguir leyendo:
Futbolistas del Olympique de Marsella tiroteados por ladrones para robarles sus coches
PSG conquista su duod√©cimo t√≠tulo de liga tras la derrota del M√≥naco y con la incertidumbre por la continuidad de Mbapp√©
Cristiano Ronaldo asegur√≥ que la liga de f√∫tbol de Arabia Saud√≠ ‚Äúes mejor‚Äù que la Ligue 1 francesa
